pageTitle: OWL 1.1 Web Ontology Language Mapping to RDF Graphs
title: Table 6. Translation of Triples to Descriptions
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {1301=Copyright © 2006 by the Submitters. This document is available under the W3C Document License. See the W3C Intellectual Rights Notice and Legal Disclaimers for additional information.}
textBeforeTable: T(SEQ y1 ... yn) denotes the encoding of an RDF list as shown in Table 1. !x denotes a named node; and x denotes a blank or a named node; _:x denotes a blank node; The following notation is used throughout this document: This document provides a mapping from the functional-style syntax of OWL 1.1 as given in [OWL 1.1 Specification] to the RDF exchange syntax for OWL 1.1 and vice versa. Every OWL 1.1 ontology can be serialized in RDF, so every OWL 1.1 ontology in RDF is a valid OWL Full ontology. The RDF syntax of OWL 1.1 is backwards-compatible with OWL DL, this is, every OWL DL ontology in RDF is a valid OWL 1.1 ontology. The semantics OWL 1.1 is defined for ontologies in the functional-style syntax. OWL 1.1 ontologies serialized in RDF/XML are interpreted by translating them into the functional-style syntax and applying the OWL 1.1 semantics [OWL 1.1 Semantics]. The syntax for triples used here is the one used in the RDF Semantics document. Full URIs are abbreviated using namespaces as usual. 1 Introduction References 3 Translation from RDF Graphs to Functional-Style Syntax 2 Translation from Functional-Style Syntax to RDF Graphs 1 Introduction Table of Contents Please send feedback to public-owl-dev@w3.org, which has a
